item.title: Twenty Months With Colemak
item.description: Time truly flies. It has been 20 months since I switched from QWERTY to Colemak keyboard layout. Am I now able to type on the Colemak keyboard as fast as the time flies? Certainly not. My typing speed 20 months ago was 75 WPM on average with QWERTY, now it’s 85 WPM on average with Colemak. I can feel the improvement and that’s why I never look back to QWERTY again.

item.title: One Week with Colemak
item.description: Last weekend, I decided to switch from QWERTY to Colemak keyboard layout. Did I suffer a lot since then? Of course no, well, maybe a little bit. After “one-week intensive typing training”, actually I quite enjoy the fresh feeling of typing with Colemak. I’m pretty happy that now I am able to type on Colemak keyboard layout with the average speed 50 WPM. I would say that it’s good enough for daily life. If you happen to be interested in switching to Colemak, here are my short notes for every day of last week and how my “intensive” training looks like.
